questions.question_text: Which of the following is an unsecure remote access protocol?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
From the Telnet wikipedia site:

"Experts in computer security, such as SANS Institute, recommend that the use of Telnet for remote logins should be discontinued under all normal circumstances, for the following reasons:

Telnet, by default, does not encrypt any data sent over the connection (including passwords), and so it is often feasible to eavesdrop on the communications and use the password later for malicious purposes. Security-related shortcomings have seen the usage of the Telnet protocol drop rapidly,[11] especially on the public Internet, in favor of the Secure Shell (SSH) protocol, first released in 1995. SSH has practically replaced Telnet, and the older protocol is used these days only in rare cases to access decades-old legacy equipment that does not support more modern protocols."

Selected Answer: C
The main answer is that a printer would typically use a USB or Ethernet connection. However, some modern printers also utilize wireless technologies like Bluetooth. The chosen connection will depend on the specific model of the printer and the environment in which it will be used

Selected Answer: C
Install a printer with USB connectivity.

questions.question_text: Which of the following cable types is the standard connector on printers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
PoE: 15.4W
PoE+: 30W
PoE++: 60W

af (15.4 watts) 
at (25.5 watts) - 30 watts)
Bt (71.3 watts) the maximum is supposed to be "bt" right?

PoE can provide (15.4 watts) over Cat-5 cables.
PoE+ switches support devices such as video IP phones, wireless access points with multiple antennas, and complex surveillance cameras. 
PoE+ can supply up to (30 watts) over Cat-5 cables, (with (25.5W) available to devices.
PoE++ switch supports up to (60 watts) of power to each port under (Type 3) 
PoE++ switch supports up to the highest level of power (100W) on each PoE port under (Type 4) for Ethernet switches.
ANSWER= B =30 WATTS. 802.3 af=15 watts= PoE, 802.3 at=30 watts=PoE+, 802.3 bt=60 watts=PoE++ ALIAS TYPE 1,TYPE 2, TYPE 3,TYPE 4.

Selected Answer: B
A PoE+ PSE provides a maximum of 30 watts of power at 48vDC.

Selected Answer: B
The earliest PoE switches from a few years ago generated 15 Watts per port (IEEE 802.3af). Today, most use the PoE+ standard (IEEE 802.3at), which generates up to 30 Watts per port. That's plenty for most devices that people want to connect

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MAXIMUM power PoE+ provides?

A user reports the touch screen on an Android smartphone is not responding to any input. The technician has cleared the cache, restarted the phone, and ensured the phone is fully charged. The issue still persists. Which of the following should the technician replace on the phone to MOST likely resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
If the phone was fully charged, the cache cleared and the device was restarted then could be an issue with the digitizer "because of the way it converts analog touch input to digital software instructions. The digitizer is sandwiched between a layer of protective glass and the display panel". CompTIA CertMaster Learn

Selected Answer: C
The answer is Digitizer because it's related to the touch screen while accelerometer focuses on motion. Gyroscope is mostly about orientation. So C is correct/

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the SAFEST way to replace RAM on a server that has a redundant power supply?

choices.D: Replace the RAM while the server is running

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Utilize a grounding strap.

It is important to ensure that the server remains properly grounded when working on it, particularly when handling internal components like RAM. This helps prevent static discharge which can damage delicate components like RAM. By using a grounding strap, the technician is connected to the earth ground and thus any static charge is safely discharged before it can cause harm. Additionally, it is not recommended to unplug one power cable as the redundant power supply may not provide sufficient power to the server. Verifying the RAM temperature is not necessary, as it is not the cause of the issue. And replacing the RAM while the server is running is not safe, as it may cause the server to crash or corrupt data.

Selected Answer: C
This was on my exam from 1/25/23. I chose C assuming the server was still running and you don't want to be conducting any electrical charge while replacing it.

comments.content: Yes. A grounding strap is an ESD strap
